decision_conditions: The proposed amendments cannot be accepted as a minor material amendments to planning permission Ref: 178784FUL, amended by reference 185616VAR dated 11/10/2019, in accordance with Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990) and the Ealing Protocol for 'Minor material Amendments following grant of planning permission', on the following grounds: the proposed 2 studio flats would fail to provide adequate living conditions as north facing, single aspect dwellings resulting in non-compliant daylight and sunlight standards, as well as issues relating to noise, air quality, ventilation and overheating. The proposed flats would have a lack of privacy amenity space provision and subsequent barriers from adjacent communal amenity space, resulting in a materially detrimental impact on both the amenity of future resident and neighbouring users. As such, the proposal is contrary to London Plan (2021) policy D4 and D6, Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) 7B, the Technical Housing Standards, the Mayor's Housing SPG and Ealing's Protocol for Minor Material Amendments following grant of planning permission (2015).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), in pursuant to planning permission reference 178784FUL, amended by reference 185616VAR for the addition of 8 flats resulting in a total of 139 units, dated 11/10/2019, for 'Redevelopment of the site to provide 131 flats and 479sqm commercial floor space accommodated within a part seven to nine storey residential building fronting onto the High Street with ground floor commercial use (retail, and/or financial/professional services, and/or restaurant/caf√© - flexible A1, A2 and A3 use classes)(Block A); and an adjoining part three to five storey residential building fronting onto Shrubbery Road (Block B); together with associated pedestrian through-access, disabled car parking, cycle storage, private and communal amenity spaces, refuse and recycling storage, and hard and soft landscaping'. This variation seeks to bring forward a conversion of the approved management office and management storage units to two studio flats, increasing the total number of units to 141 flats.
